author: Luke A. Nichter
title: A Vietnam Myth That Refuses to Die
text:
The death of Anna Chennault, informal adviser to five presidents, late last month attracted attention mostly because of her role in a controversy during the final week of October 1968. Most of her obituaries accepted as fact that she intervened, at the behest of Richard Nixonâ€™s presidential campaign, to sabotage the peace talks President Lyndon B. Johnson intended to follow his pre-election surprise announcement of a bombing halt in Vietnam.

I was the last historian to interview Anna Chennault, in April 2017 at her Watergate...
